replies.body: 1 months exactly till exams. We get off school by then and and have exactly 12 days of exams. Good news is we do exams at school gym and then we can go do whatever we want c=.
replies.body_tagged: 1 months exactly till exams. We get off school by then and and have exactly 12 days of exams. Good news is we do exams at school gym and then we can go do whatever we want c=.

replies.body:
A little tip...

Create a timetable for a suitable amount of work each night with an hour before you go to sleep free to relax and do whatever you want. Don't do hours at once, because after 45 minutes your brain starts to get tired and won't register the information. So do half an hour of work - take a break - then get back to it.

These are the most important exams, but also one of the most important times of your life so don't let revision rule your world.

These are the most important exams, but also one of the most important times of your life so don't let revision rule your world.

replies.body:
Gpa is I don't know what it stands for but gpa is like ur overall knowledge with your grades in high school it goes to 4.0 if you have straight As u have a 4.0 usually 

and most colleges usually want people with a 3.0 plus so it shows ur grades in a number form I guess
replies.body_tagged:
Gpa is I don't know what it stands for but gpa is like ur overall knowledge with your grades in high school it goes to 4.0 if you have straight As u have a 4.0 usually 

and most colleges usually want people with a 3.0 plus so it shows ur grades in a number form I guess

reply_to.body: Nice. What's gpa?
reply_to.body_tagged: Nice. What's gpa?

replies.body:
It stands for Grade Point Average.

As Shah said, 4.0 is a perfect GPA, colleges usually have a minimum GPA requirement to enter.

Some scholarships require a high GPA
replies.body_tagged:
It stands for Grade Point Average.

As Shah said, 4.0 is a perfect GPA, colleges usually have a minimum GPA requirement to enter.

Some scholarships require a high GPA
